meanings.definition: A barrier or structure used to prevent balls from leaving a playing area in sports such as baseball or softball.
meanings.sent1: The backstops at the baseball field keep the balls from flying out.
meanings.sent2: The softball game had sturdy backstops to catch any stray balls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the backstops were giant nut holders.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted as a backstops against any distractions.
meanings.sent5: The bright red backstops stood out against the green field.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that provides support or protection in case of failure or loss.
meanings.sent1: In tough times, friends can be our emotional backstops.
meanings.sent2: Insurance serves as a financial backstops during emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear became the child's backstops against fear of the dark.
meanings.sent4: His experience in the field acted as a backstops for the team's success.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse served as a reliable backstops for ships in the storm.
